chunks.cleaned_english_translation: He survives a shipwreck. While crossing the Rhone River by boat with the local nobles, an incident occurred where one horse attempted to kick another. The kick hit a plank of the boat, exactly at a spot where a branch had been removed during its construction. As soon as the plank broke, water rushed in through the hole, quickly filling the boat to the surface. Yet, guided by divine intervention, the boat reached the other bank fully loaded. Father Odo remained inside until everyone else had disembarked. Finally, after he got off, the ship sank into the depths. This situation clearly shows the remarkable nature of this man, who, through his prayers, achieved what was once granted to Peter and Paul, and then to our father Benedict.
chunks.original_latin:
Naufragium evadit. 17. Quodam tempore dum Rhodani alveum navigio
transiret, comitantibus illum optimatibus regionis
illius, contigit, ut dum unus equus alium vellet calce
percutere, ictum ferientis navigii tabula excepit, illo
videlicet loco, ex quo ramus fuerat cum dolaretur
excisus. Mox ut evulsus fuit vertex, tanta per idem
foramen inundatio ingressa est aquae, ut subito repleretur
navis usque ad superficiem. Sic tamen plena
 Deo gubernante ad aliam pervenit ripam. Etenim
usque adeo pater Odo intro stetit, quo omnes fuissent
egressi. Ad postremum cum fuisset ille egressus,
navis abiit in profundum. Qua in re videlicet cujus
meriti vir iste fuerit perspicue claret, qui hoc suis
obtinere valuit precibus, quod prius meruerunt
Petrus et Paulus, dein pater noster Benedictus.
